page.title: 04WATERCRESS NEAR ANDOVER
page.content: Just outside the village of{St {Mary Bourne}can be seen what is said to be the largest single site devoted to the growing of{watercress}in the UK, and possibly in the world. The seventeen acre plot of watercress beds forms part of the large operations of {"Hampshire Watercress",}the country's leading producer. At present the work includes propagating and planting seedlings, harvesting, packing and refrigerating the freshly cut cress, and finally distributing almost daily to wholesalers and retail outlets all over the country . The area also houses the group's main servicing and machine-making depot, and an extended packing complex is planned for the near future.
